senses.de: To have in your mind an image, sound or information from the past
senses.ex: Do you remember the first time we met?

Tips.title: Past Events
Tips.description: Use 'remember' to talk about experiences, events, or people from your past.
Tips.example: I remember the thrill of my first rollercoaster ride.

Tips.title: Visual Memory
Tips.description: Precede 'remember' with 'can' when asking if someone has a mental image of something.
Tips.example: Can you remember what she was wearing?

Tips.title: Emotional Recall
Tips.description: 'Remember' is often used for recollecting personal and emotional memories.
Tips.example: I'll always remember how you helped me.

senses.de: To keep information in your mind or to have the ability to bring it into consciousness

Tips.title: Active Reminder
Tips.description: Use 'remember' when you remind someone to do something in the future.
Tips.example: Remember to lock the door when you leave.

Tips.title: Mental Retention
Tips.description: Indicate holding onto facts or information, often for academic or professional purposes.
Tips.example: She has an incredible ability to remember statistics.

senses.de: To honor or acknowledge someone or something by doing something special
senses.ex: We remember the soldiers by observing a moment of silence.

Tips.title: Special Observance
Tips.description: 'Remember' can mean to formally honor or celebrate someone or something.
Tips.example: We wear poppies to remember those lost in war.

Tips.title: Personal Tribute
Tips.description: Use 'remember' to describe a gesture made to personally honor someone.
Tips.example: I remember my grandfather by wearing his watch.

senses.de: To mention something to someone because you think it may be important or useful
senses.ex: Will you remember me to your parents?

Tips.title: Important Mention
Tips.description: Use 'remember' to stress the importance of mentioning something or someone to others.
Tips.example: Please remember my regards to your family.

Tips.title: Cultural Politeness
Tips.description: It's polite in some cultures to ask someone to 'remember' you to others.
Tips.example: Remember me to your colleagues when you return to work.

Memorize.wordDefinition:
However, to memorize something means to intentionally commit it into your memory by repeating it over and over again until it becomes second nature.

For example, you might memorize a speech or a presentation, or some formulas for a math test.

Remember is recalling something stored in your memory while memorize is intentionally learning something to retain in your memory for future recall.

Recall.wordDefinition:
Both recall and remember refer to the process of retrieving information from memory.

However, recall is usually used when trying to retrieve specific information that has been previously learned or experienced.

For example, trying to recall a specific phone number or the name of a person.

Recall is applicable when trying to retrieve specific information from memory, while remember describes the general act of retaining information in memory.

Recollect.wordDefinition:
Recollect and remember are similar words but have slightly different meanings.

Recollect is the act of recalling something that may not be very clear or vivid in one's mind. It's like trying to remember something that is hazy or unclear.

For example, if you're trying to remember a childhood memory, you might have to recollect the details by asking family members or looking at old photos.

Recollect is applicable when trying to retrieve details that are not very clear in one's mind, while remember is applicable when recalling something that is clear and vivid in one's mind.

Reminisce.wordDefinition:
Reminisce means to indulge in pleasant memories of the past, often with a sense of longing, and usually with someone else.

Remember is to recall specific facts or events from the past, while reminisce is to enjoy and talk about past memories with feelings.

Retain.wordDefinition:
Retain means that you can keep information in your memory or keep an object or position, and not lose it. For example, if you study hard for a test, you will be able to retain the information you learned in your memory.

Remember refers to bringing something to mind from the past or stored memory, whereas retain refers to holding onto something in one's memory or keeping possession of something.

Retrospect.wordDefinition:
Retrospect refers to looking back on past events or situations with a critical eye or reflection. This means that when you retrospect, you're both observing and evaluating those past events.

You use remember when you're trying to recall something from memory and retrospect when you're looking back on past events or situations with a critical eye or reflection.

Think of.wordDefinition:
The phrase think of suggests that you are trying to come up with a new idea, concept or memory. For example, if you want to think of a new topic to write an essay, you are trying to come up with a fresh idea.

Remember is used to recall something you already know, while think of is used when you want to come up with something new.

quotes.Text: If you want to be a great leader, remember to treat all people with respect at all times. For one, because you never know when you'll need their help. And two, because it's a sign you respect people, which all great leaders do.
quotes.Title: English Author
quotes.Name: Simon Sinek

quotes.Text: Remember, if you ever need a helping hand, it's at the end of your arm, as you get older, remember you have another hand: The first is to help yourself, the second is to help others.
quotes.Title: British Actress
quotes.Name: Audrey Hepburn

quotes.Text: All my life, all my life that I can, as far back as I can remember, I saw my first movie when I was six years old. And since then I wanted to do that. I wanted to be a part of that.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Morgan Freeman

quotes.Text: We must welcome the future, remembering that soon it will be the past; and we must respect the past, remembering that it was once all that was humanly possible.
quotes.Title: Spanish Philosopher
quotes.Name: George Santayana

quotes.Text: Remember, each one of us has the power to change the world. Just start thinking peace, and the message will spread quicker than you think.
quotes.Title: American Artist
quotes.Name: Yoko Ono

quotes.Text: At some point in life the world's beauty becomes enough. You don't need to photograph, paint or even remember it. It is enough.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Toni Morrison

quotes.Text: As a child, I watched 'Dallas' and that was my vision for my life for as long as I could remember.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Will Smith

quotes.Text: Akron, Ohio, is my home. It will always be remembered. Akron, Ohio, is my life.
quotes.Title: American Basketball Player
quotes.Name: LeBron James

quotes.Text: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Mark Twain

quotes.Text: It is important to remember yourself.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Alice Walker
